text: You can attempt the head but there will still be cookies to track status… I’d reach out to support to get official answer
Can you provide a url and I can help you find it
Are you just trying to get the token ID? Or are you just trying to understand that it is there?

<@U04AQA0QM8E> <@U25PYL3Q8> This does appear to be the case although I think it's a separate cookie that is used for pref tracking and the other cookies are created but not used. It would be interesting to see an audit of this to make sure they truly aren't used. It's not 100% unclear if it's our responsibility to block those cookies from being added in a scenario where cookie laws are strict.

I tried but the required HubSpot object isn't available in the head so I'd need to create some kind of event watcher. I think in the end the only thing that makes sense is to use HubSpot's cookie system
Are you trying to use an outside item?
No matter what there are going to be some HubSpot items that are tracking on local storage (these cookies need to exist so that they know not to track you)
it's a HubSpot object that isn't loaded yet
I also have no understanding why anyone would not use the HubSpot cookie system, I’ve never seen a use case where someone should use a different system, but I hear people implement it all the time
<@U25PYL3Q8> I agree. HubSpot cookie system is the way to go. Doing everything I can to make that happen
if you need to send events to google tag manager, this is a gist I have saved
then you can handle your marketing items in GTM and trigger based off the events

If you don’t mind me asking, what events are you still seeing being tracked? If it’s just page events (views, actions), you’d still be compliant with most international privacy regulations (like GDPR).
